contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox German district| name=Warendorf| state=North Rhine-Westphalia| capital=[[Warendorf]]| regierungsbezirk=[[Münster (region)|Münster]]| area=1,317.017|Kreisschlüssel = 05570 | population=281.329| population_as_of=2001| density=214| carsign=WAF| url=http://www.kreis-warendorf.de| map=North_rhine_w_waf.png }} '''Warendorf''' is a ''Kreis'' (district) in the northern part of [[North Rhine-Westphalia]], [[Germany]]. Neighboring districts are [[Steinfurt (district)|Steinfurt]], [[Osnabrück (district)]], [[Gütersloh (district)|Gütersloh]], [[Soest (district)|Soest]], district-free city [[Hamm]], [[Coesfeld (district)|Coesfeld]] and the district-free city [[Münster]]. ==History== In medieval times the region was part of the [[Prince-Bishopric of Münster]]. When it became part of the [[Prussia]]n Province of [[Westphalia]], the new government in 1816 created the districts of Warendorf and Beckum. In 1975 these two districts were merged to form today's district. ==Geography== The district is located east of the city of [[Münster]]. The [[Ems (river)|Ems]] river runs through the district from east to west. The [[Lippe River]] forms part of the southern border of the district. ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top ||[[File:Wappen des Kreises Warendorf.svg|130px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms is a combination of the two coats of the precursor districts Warendorf and Beckum. The two sun roses are taken from the Warendorf coat of arms, which took it from the family coat of arms of the Vogt family in Warendorpe. The wavy line comes from the Beckum coat of arms, and symbolized the richness of water in the area, especially the [[Werse]] river. The coat of arms was granted in 1976. |} ==Towns and municipalities== [[File:Municipalities in WAF.svg|350px|right|Municipalities in Warendorf District]] {| !align=left width=50%|Towns !align=left width=50%|Municipalities |- valign=top || #[[Ahlen]] #[[Beckum, Germany|Beckum]] #[[Drensteinfurt]] #[[Ennigerloh]] #[[Oelde]] #[[Sassenberg]] #[[Sendenhorst]] #[[Telgte]] #[[Warendorf]] || #[[Beelen]] #[[Everswinkel]] #[[Ostbevern]] #[[Wadersloh]] |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Kreis Warendorf}} * [http://www.kreis-warendorf.de Official website] (German) {{Germany districts north rhine-westphalia}} {{Coord|51.92|7.92|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Warendorf (District)}} [[Category:Districts of North Rhine-Westphalia]] [[Category:Warendorf (district)| ]]
